body.p: Code correction in eclim is equivalent to the quick fix functionality of eclipse. When you save a java source file, eclim validates the file and notes which lines contain errors. To have eclim suggest possible corrections for an error, you simply place the cursor on the error line and issue :JavaCorrect.

The result will be a small window opened at the bottom of vim where any correction proposals will be noted. To apply a suggested change, simply move the cursor to the line describing the modification and hit <Enter>. Upon doing so, the change will be applied to the source file.
